justification: “Experiment 1 explored the ‘disruption resistance’ nature of intention … A disruption was introduced as a ‘drift’ that nullified the agent’s action… An intention-driven agent should commit to the original destination by fighting against the drift.”

measured_by: crossroad navigation task choosing fixed-future vs open-ended path (Experiment 2)
justification: “Experiment 2 explored the ‘Ulysses-constraint of freedom’ as the proactive constraint of one’s freedom … The opportunity of ‘self-binding’ was presented at a crossroad with two paths: an open-ended path … or a fixed-future path that leads to only one destination.”

measured_by: continuous Pac-Man-like navigation task choosing old vs new destination (Experiment 3)
justification: “Experiment 3 explored the ‘temporal leap’ nature of intention as committing to a distant future even before reaching the proximal one… A temporal leap implies a bias towards reaching the old destination as it has already been planned into the chain.”
